user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_queue_auth_required_response3:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_queue_auth_required_response3 (struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                                   const char *realm,
                                   const char *opaque,
                                   const char *domain,
                                   struct MHD_Response *response,
                                   int signal_stale,
                                   enum MHD_DigestAuthMultiQOP mqop,
                                   enum MHD_DigestAuthMultiAlgo3 malgo3,
                                   int userhash_support,
                                   int prefer_utf8)
{
  struct DigestAlgorithm da;
  char *buf_ptr;
  enum MHD_Result ret;

  buf_ptr = NULL;
  digest_setup_zero (&da);
  ret = queue_auth_required_response3_inner (connection,
                                             realm,
                                             opaque,
                                             domain,
                                             response,
                                             signal_stale,
                                             mqop,
                                             malgo3,
                                             userhash_support,
                                             prefer_utf8,
                                             &buf_ptr,
                                             &da);
  digest_deinit (&da);
  if (NULL != buf_ptr)
    free (buf_ptr);
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (NULL != buf_ptr)
    free (buf_ptr);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. The fragment only checks buf_ptr and calls free(buf_ptr). The function MHD_queue_auth_required_response3 does not call itself directly or indirectly in this fragment — its callees are digest_setup_zero, queue_auth_required_response3_inner, digest_deinit and free, none of which call back to MHD_queue_auth_required_response3 in the provided code.
